alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Canadian (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 8:27AM CDT until June 05 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Watonga affecting Blaine and Canadian Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Watonga. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Near bankfull conditions exist along the river may occur. The river reach affected extends from near Watonga in Blaine County... downstream to near Calumet in western Canadian County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is near crest. - Action stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 830 PM CDT.
